content.description: A car travels on a straight track. During the time interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 60 seconds, the car’s velocity v, measured in feet per second, and acceleration a, measured in feet per second per second, are continuous functions. The table above shows selected values of these functions.
content.question: Using appropriate units, explain the meaning of  <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <munderover> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> </mrow> </munderover> <mrow> <mi>a</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FA8@</annotation> </semantics> </math>  in terms of the car's motion. Find the exact value of  <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <munderover> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> </mrow> </munderover> <mrow> <mi>a</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FA8@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
